Class Event

java.lang.Object
org.mio.progettoingsoft.model.events.Event
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddCreditsEvent, AddCrewEvent, AddGoodEvent, AddPendingGoodEvent, AddPlayerCircuit, AskLeaveEvent, CannonHitEvent, CrashEvent, GenericErrorEvent, LandOnPlanetEvent, LeavePlayerEvent, MetoriteEvent, MovePlayerEvent, RemoveComponentEvent, RemoveEnergyEvent, RemoveGoodEvent, RemoveGuestEvent, RemovePendingGoodEvent, SetCardPlayedEvent, SetCardStateEvent, SetPlayedCard, SetStateEvent
public abstract sealed class Event extends Object permits AddCreditsEvent, AddCrewEvent, AddGoodEvent, AddPendingGoodEvent, AddPlayerCircuit, AskLeaveEvent, CannonHitEvent, GenericErrorEvent, LandOnPlanetEvent, LeavePlayerEvent, MetoriteEvent, MovePlayerEvent, RemoveComponentEvent, RemoveEnergyEvent, RemoveGoodEvent, RemoveGuestEvent, RemovePendingGoodEvent, SetCardPlayedEvent, SetCardStateEvent, SetPlayedCard, SetStateEvent, CrashEvent
An abstract sealed class representing a generic game event. Events are used to communicate state changes or actions within the game model and to propagate these changes to connected clients. All events are associated with a nickname, typically representing the player who initiated or is affected by the event.

      protected final String nickname

  • Constructor Details

    • Event

      public Event(String nickname)
      Constructs a new Event with the specified player nickname.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player associated with this event. Can be null if the event is not player-specific.

  • Method Details

    • getNickname

      public String getNickname()
      Returns the nickname of the player associated with this event.
      Returns:
      The player's nickname, or null if not applicable.

    • send

      public void send(Map<String,VirtualClient> clients)
      Default method for sending the event to clients. This method should ideally be overridden by concrete event subclasses to provide specific logic for how that event is handled by VirtualClients.
      Parameters:
      clients - A map of connected clients, where the key is the client's nickname and the value is the VirtualClient object.
